onset.Description: Onset (in seconds) of the event measured from the beginning of the acquisition of the first volume in the corresponding task imaging data file.

duration.Description: Duration of the event (measured from onset) in seconds. A value of zero implies an impulse-like event.

sample.Description: Onset of the event according to the sampling scheme of the recorded modality.

value.Description: Marker value indicating the event type, including cues, stimuli, ratings, and task structure markers.

Levels.12: Cue: Reappraise – instruction to reinterpret the upcoming image (non-social, negative)
Levels.13: Cue: Watch – instruction to passively view the upcoming image (non-social, negative)
Levels.14: Cue: Watch – instruction before a neutral non-social image
Levels.15: Cue: Reappraise – instruction to reinterpret the upcoming image (social, negative)
Levels.16: Cue: Watch – instruction to passively view the upcoming image (social, negative)
Levels.17: Cue: Watch – instruction before a neutral social image
Levels.18: Stimulus: Negative non-social image – Reappraise condition
Levels.19: Stimulus: Negative non-social image – Watch condition
Levels.20: Stimulus: Neutral non-social image – Watch condition
Levels.21: Stimulus: Negative social image – Reappraise condition
Levels.22: Stimulus: Negative social image – Watch condition
Levels.23: Stimulus: Neutral social image – Watch condition
